definitions.definition: a quantity of precious metals, gems, or other valuable objects.
examples: riches, valuables, jewels, gems, gold, silver, precious metals, money, cash; Morewealth, fortune; treasure trove "a casket of treasure"Morewealth, fortune; treasure trove a casket of treasure

definitions.definition: a person whom the speaker loves or who is valued for the assistance they can give.
examples: the housekeeper is a real treasure—I don't know what he would do without her
synonyms: one in a million "she's a real treasure"

definitions.definition: keep carefully (a valuable or valued item).
examples: cherish, hold dear, prize, value greatly; Moreadore, dote on, love, be devoted to, worship, venerate "I treasure the photographs I took of Jack"Moreadore, dote on, love, be devoted to, worship, venerate I treasure the photographs I took of Jack
the island is treasured by walkers and conservationists
